data.title: Hampton Street Grill
data.text: Great place to eat with friends! Good food and friendly wait staff. Small restaurant with huge reputation.

data.title: Horrible, Manager was rude
data.text: Went there during St Patty's Day event tonight, and we were overlooked by our waitress along with other customers for people coming in after us, then the Manager brought our drinks then failed to come back for our order along with our waitress totally overlooking us. I had to flag our waitress down to pay our tab for drinks, then the Manager came over and was very rude, asked that we just leave, after I commented to how terrible we were treated. We went to Flipside nearby great service. I'm considering cancelling my corporate membership to City Club after this terrible ordeal☹

data.title: Great food-Great service-GREAT place to eat
data.text: Excellent menu selections-part of the Rock Hill City Club-open to the public-fair prices-high recommend

data.title: Great food and impressive service
data.text: We came to try this cafe out and was very pleased! The food is amazing! Gumbo was freshly made, not boil in a bag. Carolina burger is to die for and the salads are the best!

data.title: Small and classy
data.text: Hampton Street is easy to miss because it's so small, but that also the charm.  Just a few tables and good food make it a nice quiet place to have lunch.  Great staff and good prices.

data.title: Good lunch place
data.text: Quiet place for lunch. No blaring music, banging dishes. Good food. The restaurant is the non-membership part of the City Club- works out of their kitchen.  All I've had is the Ruben, twice- it was excellent, and prices seemed reasonable.

data.title: American w/gourmet twist
data.text: Stopped in for dinner, new time for them, so not busy. Service very good our server was eager to please. Food very tasty. Menu has burgers and sandwiches but with a gourmet spin on them. we had delicious homemade chips with cheese and bacon for an appetizer and personal pizzas to share. All fresh ingredients, made to order- be attention for real good fresh food. Dessert was shared- creme brûlée and salted caramel ice cream.  My innkeeper referred s here as it is a busy lunch spot, but she was unaware they are open for dinner now too.  Give it a try

data.title: great food!
data.text: our HS reunion committee decided to try this restaurant one night and we had some great food with some really great company!  Our waitress was by herself so she was working double time but did a great job!

data.title: Hamton Street Cafe
data.text:
Ate at Hampton Cafe tonight - HB steak and Talapia sandwich - waiter was very nice and cordial  but we had to wait a long time for food - there was an event at City Club which was loud and noisy in the restaurant - Hampton was not busy - 3 tables including us - my fish sandwich - bun was ice cold  - fish was hot  -   HB steak dinner was OK -   warm not  hot - no side rolls for the entree - 
I would not recommend  -

data.title: Charming Cafe in Old Town
data.text: We began with soup, a spicy chicken and sausage gumbo and a potato bacon soup were perfect for a cold morning. I, for one, hate cold soup fortunatly these came from the kitchen piping hot. We also had a spicy chicken sandwitch with pub chips. Service was excellent and a nice view of downtown Rock Hill, SC. added to the pleasant experience.
